message:
Inter IIT Cultural Meet | Literary Cup

Riding on the rousing success of the Quiz contingent of IIT Kharagpur, the literary and speaking arts team managed to secure the Literary Cup for IIT Kharagpur. The individual standings were as follows.

Online English Story Writing: Bronze
Online Book Review: Silver

Team Scholars' Avenue congratulates the winners.

Inter IIT Cultural Meet | Speaking Arts Cup

Despite a strong all-round performance, the KGP Speaking arts team, led by Antra Saxena and Lalit Khemlani, lost out on the pole position by 1.5 points to Delhi. The standings in the individual events were as follows.

English Poetry: Joint Gold with IIT Roorkee
Turncoat: Gold
Parliamentary Debate: Gold

Team Scholars' Avenue congratulates the winners, and wishes them luck in their future endeavors.

Inter IIT Cultural Meet | Fine Arts and Design Cup

The Fine Arts team of the IIT Kharagpur contingent, led by Aahan Tiwari, showcased their creative brilliance by bagging the runners up trophy. Their standings in the individual events were as follows: 
Live Sketching: Gold 
Street Art (charcoal sketching): Bronze
Painting: Silver 
Online Doodle: Gold
Online Graphic Design: Bronze 

Team Scholars' Avenue congratulates the medal holders and wishes them luck for future events.

story: The Scholars' Avenue added 6 new photos.
message:
Inter IIT Cultural Meet | Quiz
After a very active and happening semester, the IIT Kharagpur Quiz Club ended the year on a positive note by bagging the Quiz and Literary Cup, led by captain Mayank Roy for the Kharagpur contingent by securing one gold, two silvers and a bronze out of five quizzing events that took place.
India Quiz: Silver
Team: Ashutosh Dwivedi, Piyush Kedia and Shubham

MELA Quiz: Silver
Team: Amit Kumar Ram, Piyush Kedia and Baibhab Pattnaik

Sports Quiz: Bronze
Team: Abhimanyu Bharade, Piyush Kedia and Deepanshu Sinha

General Quiz: Gold
Team: Abhimanyu Bharade, Piyush Kedia and Shubham

The Scholars' Avenue congratulates IIT Kharagpur Quiz Club for their strong performance and wishes them best of luck for the upcoming Inter IIT-IIM Quiz Fest, Nihilanth at IIM Ahmedabad.

story: The Scholars' Avenue added 2 new photos.
message:
Inter IIT Cultural Meet | Music Cup
With Sreekar Saripalli as team captain, Kharagpur bagged the Gold medal in the events Pair-on-Stage and the band competition, leaving audiences speechless with their juxtaposition of eastern and western music performances. With this, they ensured that the Music Cup came into the hands of Kharagpur. 
The Scholars' Avenue congratulates the winners.

Inter IIT Cultural Meet || General Quiz
In a show of absolute dominance, IIT KGP came on top in General Quiz led by captain Mayank Roy. Team KGP comprised of PiyushKedia, Abhimanyu Bharade and Shubham sealed the quiz with seven questions remaining. With this, IIT KGP leads the tally in quiz events.
The Scholars' Avenue congratulates the winners and wishes the KGP contingent all the best for the remaining events.

story: The Scholars' Avenue shared CodeStash, IIT Kharagpur's post.
message: The Scholars' Avenue shared CodeStash, IIT Kharagpur's post. ACM ICPC 2017 || Regionals Amazing news awaits us as Team TheVindicators from IIT Kharagpur placed second in ACM ICPC Amritapuri Regionals! CodeStash, IIT Kharagpur congratulates Mayank Khetan, Pranjal Shankhdhar and Sandeep Kumar Pani. Just so that you guys can relate to the gravity of this situation, qualifying to the world finals of ACM ICPC is equivalent to being there for an Olympic level sport! The results aren't out yet, so let's hope for the best! #ICPCAmritapuriRegionals #ACMICPC2017

Inter IIT | Basketball (Men)
KGP bag gold! In what transpired to be a close encounter, the boys held their nerve and managed to beat Bombay by 5 points (56-51). As a result of that win, the basket ball team gets gold!

We congratulate the basketball team for their victory and hope that we get many more chances to do so!
#MADRush #InterIITSports2017 #KGP_Ka_Tempo_High_Hai

Inter IIT | Knockouts
Finals

Football (Silver)
IIT Kharagpur 0-2 IIT BHU

Squash (Silver)
IIT Kharagpur 0-2 IIT Bombay
Match I
Harsh Saraf 1-3 Karan Singh Rawat
12-10, 4-11, 7-11, 6-11 
Match II
Sanket Mandal 0-3 Kshiteej Prasad
2-11, 3-11, 2-11 

Badminton (Men) (Silver)
IIT Madras 3-1 IIT Kharagpur

Third Place Decider
Tennis (Women) (Fourth Place)
IIT Delhi 2-0 IIT Kharagpur
Match I (Singles)
Dilpreet Kaur 2-0 Vaishali Sharma
6-3,6-2
Match II (Doubles)
Swati Agrawal and Dilpreet Kaur 2-0 Vaishali Sharma and Bhumika Singh Rathore
7-5,6-1 

Despite the heartbreaking losses, one cannot deny the fact that the campaign has been a fantastic one. The players have made KGP proud!
We congratulate the winners and hope that we get many more chances to do so!

Inter IIT |  Basketball (Men)
In what was turned out to be a close contest, KGP managed to beat BHU by two points (57-55 (12-9, 4-21, 22-15, 19-10) in today's quarterfinal to advance into the semis. The boys will play their next game (i.e the semifinal) against Kanpur at 4:30pm on 22nd December (tomorrow).
The Scholars' Avenue congratulates the basketball team and wishes them luck for the final tomorrow!
#Go_For_Gold #MADRush #InterIITSports2017

Inter IIT |Basketball (Women)
Roorkee beat KGP to claim gold. KGP missed out on gold by losing to Roorkee in today's final (25-44 (6-14, 6-8, 9-10, 4-12)).
Nevertheless, it must be said that it was an inspiring show put up by the girls in the entire tourney. Getting a silver is no mean task!
For getting silver home, we congratulate the girls' basket ball squad and hope that we get many more chances to do so!
#MADRush #InterIITSports2017

We are proud to inform that Prof.Bhanu Bhusan Khatua, an Associate Professor at the Materials Science Centre, IIT KGP has gained international attention for his work on "Bio-waste onion skin as an innovative nature-driven piezoelectric material with high energy conversion efficiency" in collaboration with POSTECH, South Korea. Their work has been published in 'Nano Energy journal'. 

The crux of this innovation lies in their approach to finding new types of energy harvesting materials, which is one of the fields of research Prof. Khatua pursues. Their discovery of the piezoelectric property of naturally occurring and abundantly available onion peels has pushed us one step closer to realizing the dream of renewable energy. Their work documents the ability of these materials to power up small devices such as calculators, watches and mobile LCD screens by generating the required energy from different pressure pulses ranging from our minute heart beat pulses to high frequency sounds. 
The generated power from these devices could also light up 30 simultaneously connected LED's in series with each other, with a maximum capability of powering 73 LED's. They have also explored the mechanisms and working principles of these devices. The experiments were carried out practically by attaching the devices to the human chest, table fans and speakers to measure the output voltage.

The numerous potential applications of these devices from healthcare monitoring to robotics have been highlighted much in the academia and paved the way for critical acclamation.
The Scholars' Avenue congratulates the team on this success and wishes the team much more in the future. 

For more information, you can read the following articles.
https://www.nanowerk.com/spotlight/spotid=48645.php
https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city/kolkata/iit-kgp-turns-onion-skin-into-electricity/articleshow/62102402.cms

For reading the published paper, click the following link.
http://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S2211285517306468

story: The Scholars' Avenue updated their status.
message:
Inter IIT | Cricket

The match was won quite comfortably by KGP against Hyderabad by 7 wickets and 7.4 overs to spare. 

Scores:
IIT H - 89/5 (20 overs) lost to IIT KGP - 92/3 (12.2 overs)

With this win KGP sits atop the table with 3 points.

#InterIITSports2017 #MADrush #Go_For_Gold

Inter IIT | Cricket
Taking the great start to the day forward, team IITKGP emerged victorious against IITH! The match was won quite comfortably by KGP as they crushed Hyderabad to win by 7 wickets and 7.4 overs to spare.

IIT H - 89/5 (20 overs) lost to IIT KGP - 92/3 (12.2 overs)
We this big win KGP sits atop the table with 3 points! 
We congratulate all the winners while hoping we get more chances to do so!
#InterIITSports2017 #MADrush #Go_For_Gold

story: The Scholars' Avenue shared IIT KGP Sports's post.
message: The Scholars' Avenue shared IIT KGP Sports's post. 3rd Inter IIT Chess Meet, IIT Madras: IIT Kharagpur bags Gold! Our team finished at the top of the table with 11 matchpoints at the end of seven intense rounds. Today's Round 7 match between KGP and Roorkee ended in a draw, following which both finished at 11 matchpoints. However, KGP won the Gold on virtue of higher game-points (Tie-Break 3). Koustav Chakraborty, a first year undergraduate student, performed brilliantly throughout the tournament and was crucial to the team's victory. He finished as the '2nd Best Player of the Meet', very narrowly missing out from the top spot due to today's enforced draw. For detailed results, visit: http://chess-results.com/tnr318945.aspx?lan=1 IIT KGP Sports heartily congratulates the team of Saurabh Desai, Hemanth Kumar Potluri, Koustav Chakraborty, Prithwi Sinha, Vivek Gupta and Gajendra Kumar on winning the Gold! #Gold #MADrush #3rdInterIITChessMeet

Like every year we'll use the responses for filling in 'tnPedia' which is a repository of information that will be used for the benefit of next batches. Every year we have seen great enthusiastic responses from the placed students and we expect nothing less from the outgoing batch of 2018 as well.

story: The Scholars' Avenue shared Kharagpur Open Source Society - KOSS's photo.
message: The Scholars' Avenue shared Kharagpur Open Source Society - KOSS's photo. The countdown is over! Kharagpur Winter of Code is now taking student registrations. https://kwoc.kossiitkgp.in KWoC is a December long online program. For those who already know about Google Summer of Code, KWoC is going to be very helpful for you. Register yourself as a student and the instructions will follow you. For those who don't know about such open source programs, KWoC is a platform where you are going to learn about a new style of collaborative software development. Read more on the website. In simple steps: - Register yourself. - Go through the projects. - Choose one/two you want to work on. - Contact the mentor of the project. - Contribute ! Feel free to reach us anytime. With ❤️ - KOSS

With our exams just around the corner, it is difficult to ignore the host of stress and anxiety related problems they bring with them. The recent state of affairs in our campus have been very unfortunate, hugely detrimental and in contradiction to an institute with a hallowed reputation. The root of most of the problems though can be traced back to skewed and misaligned perceptions of mental health, followed by some glaring inefficiencies in the systems put in place to keep a check on the same. Our institute's latest partnership with the anonymous online counselling forum, YourDOST, is an effort directed to remove the veil on the former. 
In this light, The Scholars' Avenue had a chance to interview one of the co-founders of this organisation - Ms.Richa Singh, also alumni of IIT Guwahati, one of our sister institutes. YourDOST is offering its services to the students of IIT Kharagpur with the institute bearing all the costs. The only requirement from our side is that we sign up with them through our proxy server. 

Read on to find out more about the organisation and its journey. Don't miss this chance to check up on your mental health and all the best for the upcoming exams. 

https://medium.com/@thescholarsavenue/yourdost-when-we-need-one-the-most-340eabfde3aa

https://medium.com/@thescholarsavenue/yourdost-when-we-need-one-the-most-340eabfde3aa

With our exams just around the corner, it is difficult to ignore the host of stress and anxiety related problems they bring with them. The recent state of affairs in our campus have been very unfortunate, hugely detrimental and in contradiction to an institute with a hallowed reputation. The root of most of the problems though can be traced back to skewed and misaligned perceptions of mental health, followed by some glaring inefficiencies in the systems put in place to keep a check on the same. Our institute's latest partnership with the anonymous online counselling forum, YourDOST, is an effort directed to remove the veil on the former. 
In this light, The Scholars' Avenue had a chance to interview one of the co-founders of this organisation - Ms.Richa Singh, also alumni of IIT Guwahati, one of our sister institutes. YourDOST is offering its services to the students of IIT Kharagpur with the institute bearing all the costs. The only requirement from our side is that we sign up with them through our proxy server. 

Read on to find out more about the organisation and its journey. Don't miss this chance to check up on your mental health and all the best for the upcoming exams. 

https://medium.com/@thescholarsavenue/yourdost-when-we-need-one-the-most-340eabfde3aa

story: The Scholars' Avenue shared Alumni Cell, IIT Kharagpur's post.
message: The Scholars' Avenue shared Alumni Cell, IIT Kharagpur's post. Alumni Cell, IIT Kharagpur along with IITKGP Foundation have started a great initiative to fulfill our need for a state of the art ambulance through alumni funding. The quoted price for the ambulance is $60,000 and any excess funds will be used to improve the state of facilities in the campus which concern student wellness and health (particularly the mental health). We urge all our readers to visit the following link to support this cause. The link contains more information on how and where to direct your funds. Link: https://www.iitkgpfoundation.org/article.html?aid=297&nl

Mr. Deepit Purkayastha, Co-founder and Chief Strategy Officer of the popular news app- inshorts and an alum of our institute recently visited the campus as one of the main speakers during the Entrepreneurship Awareness Drive (EAD) event hosted by Entrepreneurship Cell, IIT Kharagpur. The Scholars' Avenue had a chance to interact with him. He spoke about the startup culture and the support network in Kharagpur and also about his motivation. We hope this provides some impetus for the budding entrepreneurs in the campus.

A team of 4 undergraduates from KGP, Raj Anand, Idal Poorekhorsandi , Anish Moonka and Priyank Sangani have been invited to the finals of ‘Creative Shock’, an International Social Business Competition. Their team ‘Alchemist’ is part of the top 10 teams, chosen from participants from over 102 countries. They have already qualified the first two rounds and have been ranked 9th worldwide. This year’s finals will be held in Vilnius, Lithuania at the ISM University of Management and Economics, from 30th Nov to 3rd Dec 2017.

They are facing tough financial constraints and are looking to raise money for this very cause through crowdsourcing and need help, especially from our esteemed alumni. They currently have raised ₹ 2,400 out of their estimated target of ₹ 3,45,100 with 18 days left to go as of now. This is another call for all those who can help them reach the target so that they may share their idea and implement it successfully. 

The link that will follow connects to their fundraising account and also has complete information regarding their initial rounds, including their preliminary presentations and video submission. More information on the team and a breakup of their expenses is also provided. You can check their ideas and their social initiatives by clicking the link. Briefly put, their product aims at tackling unemployment among the low-skilled population. They conceptualized different low-cost and unconventional marketing strategies for targeting the socially aware population. 

Link: https://www.ketto.org/fundraiser/Alchemist

This is wonderful initiative from the students’ side and every donation they receive will take them one step closer to their goal. We urge our readers to have a look at their work and decide for themselves how they can help this team of social entrepreneurs. 

For more information on the competition, 
you can visit their official page at : http://creativeshock.lt/
or their facebook page at :https://www.facebook.com/creativeshock.org/

The Scholar’s Avenue wishes the team all the best and hopes that it can reach its target in time. We hope to see many more of such initiatives in the future and are ready to help in any way possible.

story: The Scholars' Avenue added 5 new photos — with Ankit Meena and 14 others.
message:
Photography is an art where creativity and the depths of thought are challenged to dig deeper into the perspectives, which speak louder than words. 

We all carry thousands of photos in our pockets itself. Amidst this scenario, Professor Abraham George of the Department of Architecture & Regional Planning - IIT Kharagpur, supervised the exhibition of Photography, Art and Visual communication at the Atrium of the department.

The exhibition started at 4 P.M. on 9th November(Thursday) and the Atrium was visited by the Deputy Director of the institute, Prof. Sriman.K. Bhattacharyya. 

The work put up, has been done by the second year undergraduate students of the department which will be available for display till November 10 (Friday) for everyone.

The Scholars' Avenue appreciates the efforts of the students and encourages the fellow students to have a look at the exhibition!

Technology Student's Gymkhana is proud to bring Open Mic sessions for the KGPians, where you can come up with your gang to hang out or to perform anything that you like to display, it may be Standup, Sketches, Poems or anything you want to... The first session is scheduled to be on Wednesday at F244 from 8 PM. story: The Scholars' Avenue shared IIT KGP Sports's post.
message: The Scholars' Avenue shared IIT KGP Sports's post. In continuation to their Bronze medal at Spardha, IIT Kharagpur Hockey Team won the silver medal at Tempest'17 conducted by Marine Engineering and Research Institute (MERI), Kolkata on 4th and 5th November. They were second only to Army XI team which consisted of players who have represented India U-17 team and Army XI team in Johar Cup, Malaysia. Match Results are as follow:- Group matches: KGP vs St.Xaviers (0-0) KGP vs Marines B (3-0) Goals: Shaurya Veer, Mridul, SaiRam Semis - KGP vs Marines A (1-0) Goals: Gagan Sai (Penalty Corner) Final: KGP vs Army X1 (0-8) Players of Badminton team of IIT Kharagpur consisting of Saket Thavanani, Sumit Singh, Rohit Rao and Abhishek Singhal won the Gold and Silver medal in singles event and Gold in doubles event. This spectacular performance of the teams only increases the expectations of a good performance in the upcoming Inter IIT Sports Meet.

This spectacular performance of the teams only increases the expectations of a good performance in the upcoming Inter IIT Sports Meet.

story: The Scholars' Avenue shared IIT KGP Sports's post.
message: The Scholars' Avenue shared IIT KGP Sports's post. story: The Scholars' Avenue added 2 new photos.
message:
Keeping in mind the recent happenings in IIT Kharagpur, a bonfire was arranged in Azad hall as a celebration of the successful completion of their Soc-Cult night. Students took an oath against fire enunciating the importance of togetherness and helpfulness. They also went ahead saying that these Soc-Cult and bonfire nights would be a part of Azad hall culture for the years to come. The oath was written by Ashutosh Bhaskar, a boarder of the hall. 

Another purpose of this night was to distribute the prizes to the winners of the So-Cult night. The gold-winning team was awarded Zebronics music system while other two were given a coffee maker. All those winning in any individual event were presented a keyboard.

The Scholars' Avenue encourages such efforts to promote bonding and hopes this occasion would serve as a start to many more so all over the campus.

story: The Scholars' Avenue added 3 new photos.
message:
After two days of splendid performances and soaring tempo,the open IIT Dramatics ended on 31st October around midnight.
The winners are-
1st Position- Patel Hall (78 points)
2nd Position- Nehru Hall (74 points)
3rd Position- LLR Hall (73 points)
Best lead actor- Nikhil Choudhary (Nehru)
Best supporting actor- Abhay Daga (LLR) and Sumit Advani (Nehru)
Best script- LLR Hall
Best sounds and lights effects- Patel Hall
Best set and costumes- Azad Hall and RK Hall.

The Judge appreciated the efforts by all the participating Halls (Patel, Nehru, Azad, RK, RP and LBS).
"Portrayal of the vast areas of themes, ranging from emotional to the ones covering social issues and the ones that tickle you- was simply mesmerising. Clearly, they've all worked very hard.", she told us. Having judged the same event last year,she shared,"The organisation, timing and of course, the plays are better than they were last year."
Dramatics, undoubtedly, is ever evolving here!

The Scholars' Avenue congratulates all the winners.

story: The Scholars' Avenue shared IIT KGP Sports's post.
message: The Scholars' Avenue shared IIT KGP Sports's post. The Annual Sports Fest of IIT-BHU, Spardha, witnessed a blazing performance from the KGP Sports Contingent. With 98 students across 6 sports participating in the competition, IIT Kharagpur stood distinct and apprehended the podium in almost all the games. The results are as follows: Badminton (Men's - Gold Women's - Silver) The Men’s Team fascinated the show by clubbing down IIT-BHU in the finals by 3-1 and bringing home the gold medal. The Women’s also put up a similar performance and won the Silver medal, losing to NIT Rourkela in the finals. Weightlifting (Silver) In weightlifting, IIT KGP bagged the silver medal with a grand total of 20 points . IIT BHU won the gold with 22 points. We managed a gold and a silver in Under 69 Kg category, a silver and bronze in Under 77 Kg and a bronze in Under 62 Kg Category. Volleyball : (Men's - Bronze , Women's - Bronze) Both Men’s and Women’s Team finished third on the podium and secured the bronze medal. Hockey (Bronze) The Hockey Team defeated the Galgotias by 3-1 in the semifinals and finished 3rd Football (Bronze) The football team won the Bronze medal by smashing down their opponents, SRMCEM, by 5-0 in the last game. The tournament proved to be a learning curve for the basketball team with plenty of positives and experience to take from their participation. Nevertheless the teams always displayed their desire to win with their positive character on the court. IIT KGP Sports congratulates all the participants for their stupendous efforts and looks forward to an even better performance at the upcoming Inter IIT Sports Meet. Your story. Our trophy. #Go_for_Gold.

There is a dire need to reflect on the answers we had been given at the open house in order to constantly gauge how well the execution is going on. We present to you a list of questions asked and answers given in the open house. We can also be a better judge of the quality of solutions proposed and the explanations given to us, as we read it calmly in the comfort of our room, sans any rhetoric, chanting or aggression.
Let us know if we have missed any questions or if there are any clarifications to be made.

story: The Scholars' Avenue shared Technology Students' Gymkhana, IIT Kharagpur's post.
message: The Scholars' Avenue shared Technology Students' Gymkhana, IIT Kharagpur's post. Technology Students’ Gymkhana, invites applications for being part of IIT Kharagpur’s contingent for the Inter IIT Cultural meet, 2017 to be held at IIT Kanpur from Dec 28, 2017 to Dec 30, 2017. Interested students are requested to fill the forms for the events of their interest. For Literary and Speaking Arts’ Events - http://tinyurl.com/kgp-lit Captains – Lalit Khemlani (lalitkhemlani@gmail.com), Antra Saxena (antraanandsaxena@gmail.com) For Quizzing Events - http://tinyurl.com/kgp-quizzing Captain – Mayank Roy (roymayank@gmail.com) For Dance Cup- http://tinyurl.com/kgp-dance Captain – Ankit Singh (ankitsinghnunia122@gmail.com) For Film and Media Cup - http://tinyurl.com/kgp-media Captain – Abhineet Chute(abhineet.chute@gmail.com) For Dramatics Cup - http://tinyurl.com/kgp-drams Captain – Mayank Das(mayankdas6@gmail.com) , Apoorv Singhal (apoorv.singhal300@gmail.com) For Music Cup - http://tinyurl.com/kgp-music Captain - Sreekar Saripalli (sskgp05@gmail.com) For Design (Fine Arts and Design) Cup - http://tinyurl.com/kgp-design Captain - Aahan Tiwari (aahanaaravtiwari@gmail.com) For any other information, you may contact: Overall Contingent Leader – B K Vibhava(vibhubhat@gmail.com) Deputy Contingent Leader – Harsh Kumar Sharan(harsh.k.sharan@gmail.com) The deadline for application submission is 11 59 PM, 31st october, 2017

Hey KGP, thanks for turning up in the huge numbers that you did for The Open House session with our Director, Dr. Partha Pratim Chakrabarti. It was a very long session with the conclusion leaving a few students unsatisfied with the responses of the administration but nevertheless agreeing that a constructive discussion now is what the need of the hour is.
Here is a summary of the entire event with our own viewpoints as a team given along with it. 
We request all our readers, including students, alumni and the professors to give this a read and please reach out to us in case you have any points of clarification in the comments or if you have a more detailed point that you want to raise personally as a mail or a message to us.
CC: Partha P Chakrabarti Director IIT Kharagpur

https://web.scholarsavenue.org/the-open-house-october-27th-2017-88bdb3d5fe2e

Details for the Open House with the Director

Date: 27th October
Time: 7pm Onwards

Venue: To be confirmed on the same day's morning and will be communicated via a formal mail/post from the administration.

Topic: B.C. Roy Hospital and Counselling Center

Structure: The entire session will be kept for questions related to the above topic only. The first 45 minutes will be reserved for questions selected from the form floated earlier and will be chosen to cover as wide a domain as possible. The questions from people who wished to stay anonymous will be asked by the moderator. After this, the floor will be open for questions from the audience with up to one follow up allowed.

We strongly urge you to turn up for this session for a constructive discussion and redressals to your queries and problems. Do read the list of questions already shared by the VP to know which ones have already been answered.

"How many deaths will it take 'til he knows,
That too many people have died?"
- Bob Dylan

An eerily similar incident back in 2009 caused the resignation of the then Director and the Dean of Student Affairs among the multitude of events it resulted in. Three tragedies happened on 21st October 2017, 8 years later.

Dear readers, we think it is imperative that facts come out as they are. As such, this post is about how B.C Roy Hospital’s negligence and casual attitude has cost a life. 

Witnesses’ account on what transpired in that ambulance -
Nikhil’s serious condition got him referred to the nearest hospital capable of handling such cases - West Bank Hospital, Howrah. An ambulance left with two students with the patient along with an attendant and a special doctor, both of whom were said to be ‘the best’ B.C. Roy Hospital could provide. However, according to reports, their behavior towards the patient could only be accurately described as apathetic and cold. Nikhil’s multiple injuries and the bumpy ride sometimes led to his limbs moving to awkward positions. On bringing the doctor’s attention to this and asking if it would be appropriate to move it back to its original position, he glanced at the patient once and then looked away without giving any response. This was reportedly his attitude throughout the supercritical journey to Howrah, with two inexperienced boys having to take up the heavy responsibility of ensuring that Nikhil completes it alive. The ambulance was being guided by a police vehicle as the driver did not know the way to the hospital. He took a wrong turn into a one way road and in the attempt to get the vehicle back onto the main road, the ambulance broke down and everybody had to get down to push the vehicle to get it going, leaving Nikhil alone inside. It was during this ruckus that the IV drip to his arm (with the injections and the medicines) came out as well. While the doctor ignored this detail, the attendant tried to put the syringe back but then gave up saying ‘it is only a matter of 10 minutes until we arrive at the hospital’. It was at this point, the witnesses tell us, that Nikhil’s health started declining rapidly and the urgency of the situation started escalating. The broken down ambulance was proving to be a dead end, and they hitched a lift on a truck to reach the hospital. What was just a matter of ‘10 minutes’ became 45. He was barely holding on and within 10 minutes of trying to revive him in the hospital, he breathed his last. The official time of death recorded was signed off by a doctor, who arrived much after his death. 

As is pretty clear with this account, Nikhil might have made it out alive had the ambulance, and the personnel accompanying him on behalf of the hospital were competent and proactive during the entire ordeal. It is appalling that people keep dying yet the administration refuses to take any responsibility.

story: The Scholars' Avenue added 3 new photos.
message:
There has been much distortion about the suicide of Nikhil Bhatia, and this post is an attempt to clear up the specifics of the incidents the best we can. This is the first in a series of questions to the administration about the way incidents like these have been handled and the lack of facilities to deal with mental and physical health emergencies.

In a report published by ToI, which has since been corrected online (https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city/mumbai/mumbai-boy-falls-from-iit-kgp-hostel-bldg-dies/articleshow/61167804.cms), Nikhil was said to have 'accidentally fallen off the terrace of LBS while playing with his friends'. On speaking to witnesses present, we were told that his bag was found beside a dustbin on the 4th floor of the hall, and that the doors to the terrace of that wing are kept locked. The wing corridor was also empty at the time of the incident, and no one was reported to have been playing around there at all. The corridor grill is such that it'll be highly unlikely for a person of his physical stature to have accidentally fallen off, especially with the platforms at the base. We were also made aware of a previous attempt by the same student a month back in VS Hall, and his FacAd being aware of his problems (as quoted in this article -  https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city/kolkata/slain-iit-kharagpur-student-was-suffering-from-fear-psychosis/articleshow/61178382.cms). 

The incident took place at around 11am on Saturday morning, when some workers and students heard a loud thud and saw a bloodied Nikhil on the cemented ground. He was immediately taken to the B.C. Roy hospital and then referred to the West Bank Hospital, the closest hospital with an ICU being in Howrah. 

We pray he rests in peace now, and hope the rest of us can look around and fix the broken pieces that let people among us slip away. Most importantly, we hope that 5 deaths on campus in this year are enough to shake us out of this apathy and get the facilities working to fulfill the basic needs for a place with more than 20,000 people in it.

We would like to bring forward interesting opportunities for fellow KGPians. Please take a look:
______________________________

Call for Ag-Robotics proposal:

We invite students' proposal for robotics project. The project should target automation
or augmentation of agricultural operations. We may select multiple proposals, depending
upon clarity of plan and merit of the target design. Selected proposal with Budget within Rs. 50 k, may get quick approval and funding. For larger budgets, the selected proposals may need to be discussed with the team to justify cost associated with each component.

The proposal should contain the following:

(i) Title
(ii) Objective  (Target design)  (100 words)
(iii) Need and motivation behind the proposed design (max : 200 words)
(iii) Schematic diagram of the proposed design (hand-drawn would be fine)
(iv) Approach (discuss your methodology, platforms, resources needed for different aspects
      of the design. (max 300 words)
(v) Team members, their earlier experience and their responsibilities in the proposed project. (include: Name, Roll, Email, Phone, Hall, Project experiences  for each member)

(vi) Budget 

Please submit the proposal latest by 29th of October using the following link

https://www.dropbox.com/request/dCesAjEF8g0pj2Zz7PbZ

Team AgNEXT

story: The Scholars' Avenue shared External Relations Cell's GIF.
message: The Scholars' Avenue shared External Relations Cell's GIF. External Relations cell, IIT Kharagpur is very excited to announce our keynote speakers for the 'Career Talk'. Mr Umang Thareja ( Quantitative Analyst, Capital One ) and Mr Rahul Satyakam ( Co-Founder at Transenigma ) are KGP alumni and we look forward to hearing them share their experiences and answer the questions that keep popping up in the mind of KGPian who is looking for an internship or a placement. Venue: Kalidas Auditorium Date: 22nd October Time: 6PM

Mr Umang Thareja ( Quantitative Analyst, Capital One ) and Mr Rahul Satyakam ( Co-Founder at Transenigma ) are KGP alumni and we look forward to hearing them share their experiences and answer the questions that keep popping up in the mind of KGPian who is looking for an internship or a placement. Venue: Kalidas Auditorium Date: 22nd October Time: 6PM

story: The Scholars' Avenue shared Entrepreneurship Cell, IIT Kharagpur's post.
message: The Scholars' Avenue shared Entrepreneurship Cell, IIT Kharagpur's post. From the world of Bitcoins to the Craziest Marketing Strategies around, we are going to explore the true meaning of "Unconventional". Gear up KGP people, Entrepreneurship Cell, IIT Kharagpur & AmbujaNeotia presents EAD in the city of Kharagpur. Get ready to witness some great entrepreneurs in action & their scintillating stories on how they became successful! Date & Time: 15th October 2017 | 5:00 PM Venue: Kalidas Auditorium #EAD2k17 #EAD_KGP #Celebrating_Unconventionality #BeThere

Gold: Bhushan Deshmukh (79 points)
Silver: Yash Sharma (71.5 points)
Bronze: Shreyas Kaushik (71 points)

We saw a variety of instruments being beautifully played by the participants. The Scholars' Avenue congratulates all the winners!

We would like to bring to everyone's notice an opportunity to join a startup.

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Company Name: Cicerone

We are developing a unique on-line platform for career counseling and orientation, that can make a highly positive contribution to the career choice of millions of youngsters. We are privileged to have the guidance of world renowned domain experts associated with IIT Kharagpur.
We are eagerly looking forward to expand our team and involve KGPians who feel passionate about making a difference in the field of education. You are invited to lead major target project components, associated with specific broad domains, own your interest domain, and contribute to the development of an unprecedented platform.

Domains involved:

Web development
Data Analytics
Content creation
Designing
Psychoanalytics

Those interested, please fill out the following form. We plan to start our meetings next week.

Form: https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSdLbi6sX7HD8J4tsP3UyfVr72dqCup_pDUigjDpDz1mvJOhQw/viewform?c=0&w=1

Team Cicerone, IIT Kharagpur

story: The Scholars' Avenue shared Hult Prize At IIT Kharagpur's video.
message: The Scholars' Avenue shared Hult Prize At IIT Kharagpur's video. The world’s’ largest student social entrepreneurial competition is back! Don’t miss out on such a golden chance to represent KGP on an international level and become a part of the elite club. HP 2017-18 is being organized in association with AIESEC IIT Kharagpur and Technology Students' Gymkhana, IIT Kharagpur!

Team TSA would like to bring to notice a few exciting opportunities to all KGPians out there:

Technology Intervention in Indian Agriculture can make a BIG difference in lives of millions of people. We are looking for enthusiastic KGPians interested in developing end to end IT solutions for Exciting Tech Interventions in Fields like Agriculture and Animal Husbandry). We offer a platform to ideate, innovate, prototype and commercialize  impactful technology solutions. Along with existing target products and solutions, we encourage discussions on exciting new possibilities. We have a team of senior KGP students contributing in different target domains and we are looking  forward to inviting new enthusiasts.  With our team you get to work on products that are need based and can have tangible impact. 

Those interested, please fill out the following form. We plan to start our meetings in the coming week.

https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSdfbJaexyrXy5e0THXXniO8J99PjWf_hZqbeEMD6zUl36ctCw/viewform?usp=sf_link

TEAM AgNEXT
IIT Kharagpur

Communiqué in association with T.I.M.E. (Triumphant Institute of Management Education)  invites all the CAT aspirants to attend Information Seminar and Workshop on CAT 2017 and 2018. T.I.M.E. is a leading Institute for CAT preparation. With the onset of thoughts on deciding your career paths, We believe this is a good opportunity for all the final and pre-final year students to get their queries answered by professionals.

Details regarding the seminar:
Date: 10th October 2017
Day: Tuesday
Venue: Vikramshilla, V3
Time: 6:00 PM      

The seminar is FREE of cost
Kindly register at tinyurl.com/CATseminar2017

For any queries, contact
Hemanth: 9547494614
Anshul: 8436924443

We congratulate our team on their victory and wish them all the very best for the final! Your story, our trophy! #Go_For_Gold #BringItBack #MADrush

story: The Scholars' Avenue added 2 new photos.
message:
The 33rd Inter IIT Aquatics Meet ‘17 being held at IIT Madras was flagged off yesterday with a speech by Chief Guest Mr.Rehan Poncha, a five-time national champion and Arjuna Award winner, along with a diving performance and an act by Mr.Preveen Pandita, an illusionist. 

With Day 2 almost coming to a close, KGP is giving its all to bring home the coveted cup. While the Water-Polo team is going strong with two wins, the Swimming team is having a tough time facing the stiff competition. Our current medal tally consists of a silver and bronze, bagged by the men’s and women’s contingents respectively. The finals of todays events are currently underway.

We’d like to throw some light on the general structure of the tournament. We have posted below a day wise consolidated list of the events in both the categorized events – Swimming and Water Polo. 
The swimming events kick off early in the morning every day, with trials/heats held in the first half to screen the teams, out of which the top 8 contenders qualify for the finals of the respective events, which would be held in the later half of the day. This will continue for all the 4 days.
While on the other side, 4 Water Polo matches are held everyday – with each of the eight teams facing one opponent from their respective pools. The 4th day will witness the winners of each pool face the runners-up of the other pool respectively for the semifinal matches, the losers of these semis will fight for the 3rd place and the most awaited finals will be held thereafter.

We wish our KGP contingent the very best for the rest of the tournament and hope to see them shine brightly in every one of the events.

Stay tuned for more updates on the standings and results!

Our institute is in the process of revamping the existing curriculum and in regards to this, in the recently held senate, it was decided to have views from all the stake holders about the revised curricula to be implemented from Academic Year 2018-19 which will potentially be a state-of-the-art type of curriculum.

In connection to this, with the help of the UG Senate Representative and all UG Students council members, they have designed a feedback form to have every candidate's opinion. Kindly feel free to give your constructive critical inputs in the following form.

The google form link is https://goo.gl/forms/7O94TJRK37CxekyP2

The deadline is 5th October 2017.

Personal Request from the Dean: Spread the word among your friends about the above mentioned information to have better perspective of your views on curriculum.

KGP has not been in a very brilliant place on social media in the past week and we as the campus newsbody, will be expressing our opinions on that matter too. 
In the meanwhile, however, here's an Open Letter from Poonam Gupta, an alumna from the Batch of 2017, on that whole issue that sums up the views of a lot of the alumni about the issue.

We would love to start a constructive discussion in the comments section regarding this.

https://web.scholarsavenue.org/responsible-use-of-social-media-lets-not-cannibalize-our-own-reputation-c059c7e71b21

message: A petition regarding the poor internet speed in the campus on change.org is gaining traction and currently has a supporters' count of 935. This issue is certainly one which needs immediate action. One of the reporters in our team complained that in the library, the internet speed is so slow that it took 15 mins to sign the petition itself! This is a phenomenal example of the issue fighting the cause and not the other way around (and of bad humor too). Anyways, this is the link to the petition: http://chn.ge/2xcSfyJ

The Open IIT English Elocution Competition was held on 10th September.
The results are as follows-
GOLD- Mithilesh Pinjarkar (Patel) - 40 points.
SILVER- Abhrajit Saha (LBS) - 39 points.
BRONZE- Suraj K (RK), Shashwat Mondal (RK), Shreya Santra (SN), Mohit Singh (LLR) - 38.5 points.

The Scholars' Avenue congratulates all the participants for their amazing performances.

story: The Scholars' Avenue added 5 new photos.
message:
Open IIT 2017 | Social and Cultural | Postering

The Open IIT Postering event was held today at S-302 from 2 PM to 5 PM.

The participants were offered three theme choices:
1. The Power of Positivity
2. Being Beautiful
3. Essence of Peace

The event witnessed a modest turnout and all the participants put their best effort in painting their thoughts and ideas on paper.

The final standings are as follows:
1. Bandana Badu      [SN/IG Hall] (marks: 90/100)
2. Chaitanya Shinde [RK Hall] (marks:84/100)
3. Amlan Kumar        [Nehru Hall] (marks:80/100) &
    Bramha Deen       [JCB Hall] (marks:80/100)

TSA congratulates all the winners!

story: The Scholars' Avenue added 4 new photos.
message:
Tree Plantation Event | Induction Program

The Institute conducted yet another event for freshers under the Induction Program. This time it was the Tree Plantation Event. A large number of trees were planted near the Vikram Sarabhai Residential Complex. Students were split into groups of four and each group was given a plant to plant. Guava, Jamrul, Chiku were a few of the types of tree saplings planted by the freshers. This event was witness to a  large number of students participating with great enthusiasm. Each of the participating students received a cap at the end of the event.  Also, Dean of UGS Prof. S K Barai was also spotted there greeting the students participating.

Sports and Games GC (2017-18) || Inter-Hall Athletics

The 65th Inter Hall Athletics meet kick-started with great grandeur on September 9, 2017. The early morning turnout was quite modest, as the Jnan Ghosh stadium was marked by sporadic groups of people huddled together.The first event, the 1500m junior race (men's) started at 8:50 am with close to 25 participants.The standings were

1) Vikash Meena (Azad)
2) Narpat Ram Kalvanian (RK)
3) Kaushik Raj (LBS)
4) Ayush Raj (Azad)

TSA congratulates the winners. Stay tuned to our page for updates. #InterHallAthletics

story: The Scholars' Avenue added 10 new photos — with Sourish Ghosh and 2 others.
message:
Open-IIT 2017 | Sports | Table Tennis

The Open-IIT Table Tennis tournament was held on 27th and 28th August for men and women respectively. The Old-Gymkhana witnessed the intense and fast paced action where participants were seen putting in all their effort and showcasing their skills while adhering to the true spirit of sportsmanship. 

The results for the tournament were as follows:

Men-
1st- Reetam Roy(16IE10024)
2nd- Sourish Ghosh(14MA20054)
3rd- Abhinav Gupta(17ME10001)
4th- Anmol Basant(13EX20002)

Women-
1st- Akhila Kosaraju(14AR10018)
2nd- Roshni Bhowmik(16AR10030)
3rd- Ojaswee Deewan(16AG10019)
4th- Pooja Rawat(17EX20019)

The Scholars' Avenue congratulates the winners.

story: The Scholars' Avenue shared IIT KGP Sports's post.
message: The Scholars' Avenue shared IIT KGP Sports's post. The lines are drawn, the stage is set! Jnan Ghosh Stadium is in readiness to witness three days of high octane athletics events. As the Meet marks the beginning of the Inter Hall Sports General Championship, all the Halls of Residence will go all out to take home the coveted Athletics GC. Only time will tell who emerges victorious. Be there to cheer for your Hall. The Meet starts at 6:30 pm on Friday, 8th September. Attached below is the schedule for the same. #65th_Inter_Hall_Athletics_Championship #Go_For_Gold

The Open IIT Hindi Elocution event was held today at F-127 (Maggu Room) from 6 p.m. to 9 p.m. With speeches ranging from social and political satires to mythological tales to transgender rights, the enthusiastic participation of 44 students filled the room with a spectrum of emotions over the course of the event. 

The standings of the event are as follows:

Gold: Vivek Mallik (RK) | 25/25
Silver: Mohd Issa (Patel) and Yash Shukla (Nehru) | 24.5/25
Bronze: Aditya Ranjan (Azad) and Abha Kumari (SN) | 22.5/25

Professor Amit Upadhyay, the judge for the event, applauded the efforts of the participants and mentioned that we are fortunate that we enjoy such freedom of speech in our country that we can talk freely even about the most sensitive topics.

The Scholars' Avenue congratulates all the winners and the participants for their amazing performances.

गुरुर्ब्रह्मा गुरुर्विष्णुर्गुरुर्देवो महेश्वरः ।
गुरुरेव परं ब्रह्म तस्मै श्रीगुरवे नमः ॥
Teachers not only teach us, but also mould us into what we will become and show us what we can do if we put our minds to it. A good teacher can inspire us to achieve our dreams and a bad one can scar us for life; a testament to the power they have over us.
On the occasion of Dr. Sarvapalli Radhakrishnan's 129th Birthday, we at The Scholars' Avenue would like to wish all the professors of IIT Kharagpur and all the teachers of India a very Happy Teacher's Day!

P.S: A senior of this commenter once said that just greetings won't do. Let's pledge to value the teachers here by not dropping classes after two weeks in the semester and then complaining. We agree that it would be a pretty nice thing to do. After all, for all the 8 AM and 5 PM classes we haven't gone to, they have been present regardless. :')

Zakir's Surprise Visit to the Campus!
-------------------------------------------------------------
In an unprecedented move among the recent times, our beautiful campus was blessed today with what one may call a "Happiness Visit" (term coined courtesy of a fellow KGPian). Our institute has always been the unprecedented one - even during birth and even now. But a slight tumor has started to grow, something we have recognised as a universal sin plaguing the entirety of this generation and now it's caught us in its whimsical hands. Over the past few months, our campus had the most misfortune to witness the demise of a fraction of our student community, tiny in number but gigantic in worth. It's no easy feat to recuperate from such mental fractures, but all it takes is just a little push, in the right direction, to build bridges to paradise. This is exactly what we've set in motion, if we as eyes of the campus, read right today's move.

In a secretive partnership, our VP - Mayank Srivastava along with TSG had talks with Zakir Khan, the rising face of comedy in the country, and asked him to pay a surprise visit to KGP, and Zakir accepted with much humility. He did visit before, but never like this. What we read is an initiative to make people experience the feeling of unbridled happiness, happiness that is sometimes born out of surprise, or of not knowing something. We can sure as hell imagine everyone going frantically through their Facebook Timelines not really sure whether the video of Zakir sitting there, in Nehru, in between a circle of enthused students, chatting on ignoring all the cameras about him, is true or just an elaborate prank. Incidentally Zakir is shooting a series of videos which have a similar morbid theme covered, whilst with big scoops of humanity poured into them. All you guys lucky enough to have firsthand experienced that joy, you might want to stay glued to Zakir Khan on social network sites.

It's a no brainer to connect the dots now. This moment should be remembered as one which should reinforce our firm belief in our administration, and more importantly, life again, and most importantly push us towards the end of the dark tunnel that we've gotten stuck in.

Zakir will leave by a flight tonight, pertinently unaware of the hidden blessing in what he had done, and probably and promptly laying down the road to more such wonderful surprises.

We really applaud the thinking and effort that went behind such an endeavor, mainly the VP, who seized the right moment by its throbbing vein. We would very much like to see more such meaningful and brilliant moves in the future.

"A small push in the right direction can build bridges"

#Enroute_to_being_more_Sakt

The Open IIT Debate took place at F-127 on 4th of September. 
The motion stated, "What is more important, our privacy or national security?"  
The results are as follows:

Gold: Shared between Shashwata Mondal (RK) and Anurag Mondal (LBS) | 45 points 

Silver: Abhinav Sharma (RK) | 44 points

Bronze: Nirmalya Panigrahi (Azad) | 43 points 

The Scholars' Avenue congratulates all the winners and participants for their wonderful set of speeches.

The NSSC space quiz took place today at Vikramshila. The quizmaster for the event was Mr Somnath Chanda, a well-known name in Kolkata quizzing circles. It was his first quiz in IIT KGP and it lived up to expectations with a close finish. The final standings are as follows:
Winners:
 Amit Kumar Ram, Ashutosh Dwivedi, Mayank Roy (120 points)
Runners-Up:
Baibhab Pattnaik, Judhajeet Basu, Siddhant (114 points)
Second runners-up:
Rishabh Madan, Sourav Kundu, Venkatesh Pai (84 points)

TSA congratulates the winners. We also congratulate the KGP quizzing contingent for their remarkable performances in recent quizzes and hope they cap it off with a strong showing in Nihilanth, the inter IIT and IIM quizzing fest.

OPEN IIT 2017 | SOCIAL AND CULTURAL | CARTOONING

The open IIT cartooning competition was held today at S302, from 2PM to 5PM. Participants were asked to draw on any of the three topics viz., "Clean India"; "Support Disabled"; "Child Abuse". Around 30 interested students of the campus turned up with some excellent pieces of art.
The results will be declared in 2 to 3 days.

Stay tuned to our page for more updates!

The institute has officially relaxed the ban on conducting trials in halls of residence for the purpose of participation in various Open IIT and inter-hall events. The message was conveyed via an email from the Dean of Student Affairs, Prof. Somesh Kumar and has instructed that decorum may be maintained through the length of sessions. The move follows an apparent state of complete lack of communication between seniors and juniors in halls following the original ban. The message also encouraged students to participate in events like Illumination and Rangoli. The hall council members are required to document the activities and present it to VP/warden/asst. warden.

story: The Scholars' Avenue added 7 new photos — with Sunil Pathloth.
message:
'Manthan', a panel discussion on how we perceive India to grow in the next five years, was organised in Netaji Auditorium at 5 P.M. on September 2, 2017.The event started with an introduction to the mighty imprints that India have had in the past on the world history. The dynamics of the modern world and how we, as a nation, thrive to maintain the pace with the world was intriguing enough to involve the audience, for the next hour. The event proceeded with an introduction to the panelists and a pledge taken by everyone present there, guided by Mayank Srivastava (V.P -T.S.G), which was driven by the thought of 'New India- In the making'. The panel discussion, followed the pledge and the panelists put forth their views on varied topics.

The panel comprised of the below listed professors and students:
• Prof. Rabibrata Mukherjee- Department of Chemical Engineering
• Prof. Somesh Kumar- Department of Mathematics
• Prof. Nabanita Dutta- Department of Ocean Engineering and Naval Architecture
• Sh. Pradip Pyne- Registrar, IIT kgp
• Prof. Manas Mandal- Department of Humanities and Social Sciences
• Ayushi Mrigen- Department of Mathematics
• Sutirtha Roy- Department of Chemical Engineering
• Mayank Srivastava- V.P.(T.S.G)

Topics ranging from evolution of science, existing mind-sets in the country, women empowerment, ease in connectivity and research opportunities to the impact that the current boost in the start-up culture has had on the society were discussed. The discussion concluded with the belief that if all the resources available are synchronized and a proactive approach to the issues is taken, the India of our dreams could be built in the next five years, in accordance with the theme “New India - 2022”. The event was conducted in association with ‘Skill India’ and MHRD.

The panel discussion was followed by concerts by ETMS and Krosswindz, a band from Kolkata, 6 PM onwards.  The theme of music was patriotism.

Topics ranging from evolution of science, existing mind-sets in the country, women empowerment, ease in connectivity and research opportunities to the impact that the current boost in the start-up culture has had on the society were discussed. The discussion concluded with the belief that if all the resources available are synchronized and a proactive approach to the issues is taken, the India of our dreams could be built in the next five years, in accordance with the theme “New India - 2022”. The event was conducted in association with ‘Skill India’ and MHRD.

The panel discussion was followed by concerts by ETMS, WTMS and Krosswindz, a band from Kolkata, 6 PM onward.  The theme of music was patriotism.

A candlelight march, leading up to GolC, was organised today by the Ambedkar Bhagat Singh Study Circle. It was organised in the aftermath of the suicide of 17-year old Anitha who fought against the NEET. Several political parties and students have come out on the streets demanding the scrapping of NEET.

You can read more about the story here: http://www.deccanchronicle.com/nation/current-affairs/010917/dalit-girl-who-fought-neet-exam-in-sc-commits-suicide.html

IIT-Kharagpur researchers have developed a visual technology that enables safer driving during rain. 

The technology developed by researchers, led by Prof. Sudipta Mukhopadhyay, from the Department of Electronics and Electrical Communications removes from real-time video the obscuring effects of rain and displays it on the windscreen of vehicles to increase the clarity of driver's view.

story: The Scholars' Avenue is with Venkatesh Pai and 3 others.
message:
The Embassy of Sweden in India on 28th August organized Kolkata regional round of the eleventh edition of Sweden India Nobel Memorial quiz. 

The theme of the quiz is Sweden, its history, culture and innovations, Nobel Prizes and the life and works of Alfred Nobel. Four teams from IIT KGP went to Kolkata for participating in the quiz. The cutoff of the prelims was 16 out of 25, and all KGP teams scored more than the cutoff but only one could proceed to the finals due to one team per institute rule. The quiz master seemed pretty impressed with the prowess of KGP teams and said that preparedness of KGP students is on another level. 

In the finals, an IIT KGP team consisting of Amit Kumar Ram, Shreyans Sadangi and Piyush Kedia came on top, beating ISI and Heritage. 

They will participate in the National finals in the first week of October in the Sweden India Nobel Memorial week. In 2013, a team from IIT KGP won the national finals; we hope the feat is repeated this year.

The Scholars' Avenue congratulates the winners and wishes them all the best for the upcoming finals. 

Picture - IIT KGP students in Calcutta Medical College

The Scholars' Avenue added 2 new photos.
message:
Aerial Robotics, Kharagpur (ARK) took part in its second International Aerial Robotics Competition attempt ever over the past weekend, in Beijing, after last year's debut when it was the first ever Indian team from an IIT to take part in the IARC. A total of 13 teams participated. The mission this year, the seventh mission so far, has been on the board since 2014, and wasn't completed this year as well, although one team came close. This time around, with better preparation compared to last year, ARK performed significantly better, grabbing the interest of a lot of people and nabbing the Most Innovative Design Award for their hexcopter, dubbed 'Falcon'.
The team when asked for comment, had the following words, 'We are attempting to enter a field where other countries and labs have been making optimisations in for multiple years and this gives us the opportunity to learn a lot from our peers. We're confident of a better showing at the next edition and hopefully to actually achieve the competition aim of successfully completing the multi year task.'

We feel extremely sorrowful to inform the demise of Dr. Joydip Bhattacharjee. He drowned trying to save his four-year old child in Kharagpur's Golghoria area. This truly is a loss to the nation. Dr. Bhattacharjee was working in areas like water waves, wave-structure interaction and wave energy devices. He completed his Ph.D. from IIT KGP itself in the year 2008. The Scholars' Avenue extends grievances to the family of Dr. Bhattacharjee. 

http://www.thestatesman.com/cities/iit-khargapur-professor-drowns-trying-save-son-1502475320.html

story: The Scholars' Avenue added 7 new photos.
message:
A campus and its vibrancy is visible not just by how active its students are or how beautiful the campus is, but also how the students choose to use their creativity to make their halls a home, or the campus, their playground. 
Our friends over at the Department of Architecture and Regional Planning have worked on a project on utilising Alternative Spaces in the campus better to help foster a stronger community spirit.
The project, titled, 'Happiness Project - What made me' works as follows. Four coloured threads, symbolising what made you happy(yellow), angry(red), think(green) and change(blue) have been provided, and all you have to do is connect the most relevant words.The instructions to use this creative mapping technique is provided along with.
Do visit the space adjoining ARP and Bio-Technology Department and mark in your threads too. :)
We at The Scholars' Avenue visited after hearing about it and in the short time that had passed between us hearing about it and us actually visiting it, some patterns had already begun to emerge.
Follow the pictures for our first thoughts:

One of the main water source lines to KGP had a breach on the 22nd of August resulting in the cutoff of water supply to halls for maintenance work. The halls which had backup did not face any problem but some halls like MT and LBS got an intermittent supply of water, or sometimes no supply at all for long periods. 

The problem has been rectified as of now and the water supply is ongoing again, but it would take sometime to regain normalcy.

We request everybody to use water judiciously.

Hello all,

Like earlier years Placement Committee [Core Committee] will be formed to assist the Career Development Centre for better placements of students.

The students eligible are : 3rd year Dual Degree / 3rd Year Integrated M.Sc. / 1st Year M. Tech./ 1st year M.Sc.(2-year) students from all Departments / Centres / Schools.

Interested students from the above courses are advised to submit the filled Application Form (specified form has been  mailed by the VP)

The application form should be signed by the candidate and routed through the Placement In-charge of the Department / Centre / School and the same should reach the CDC Office positively by 12.00 Noon on 29th August 2017(TUESDAY).

NO applications will be accepted after the deadline under any circumstances.
While submitting the applications, the applicants should enter their name / roll number / with signature in a list available with the CDC.

Selections will be made based on a test of business communication skills followed by personal interviews. The detailed schedule is given below.

Application submission : 29th August 2017(TUESDAY) by 12.00 Noon to CDC Office
Selection Process : will be notified later

Looking forward for an active participation.

story: The Scholars' Avenue shared Technology Filmmaking & Photography Society, IIT Kharagpur - TFPS's album.
message: The Scholars' Avenue shared Technology Filmmaking & Photography Society, IIT Kharagpur - TFPS's album. Our beloved IITKGP turned 67 today. On this occasion, to show his love towards the campus and the amazing way it functions, Lokesh Deshmukh conceived the idea of The Portrait Project and Suraj Iyyengar executed it. What a better day than the institute-foundation day to show the massive love and respect we have for the 'dadas' of the campus who have laid the foundation to the kgp culture and student life. Here is a small effort towards recognising such people who're as much kgpians as we are (probably more). The list is in no way exhaustive and its just the beginning. Many more in store.

IIT Kharagpur and Tata Medical Center have agreed on institutional collaboration in education, research and outreach programmes in the field of interdisciplinary medical research.

"Plans are underway for joint research programmes with external funding. Exchange programmes will be promoted through creation of visiting faculty, scientist positions with access to laboratory facilities for joint research and exchange of data," said Prof Suman Chakraborty, Mechanical Engineering faculty and programme coordinator from IIT Kharagpur.

IIT Kharagpur and Tata Medical Center have agreed on institutional collaboration in education, research and outreach programmes in the field of interdisciplinary medical research.

"Plans are underway for joint research programmes with external funding. Exchange programmes will be promoted through creation of visiting faculty, scientist positions with access to laboratory facilities for joint research and exchange of data," said Prof Suman Chakraborty, Mechanical Engineering faculty and programme coordinator from IIT Kharagpur.

As conveyed by Professor P.P. Chakrabarti, on the ocassion of the institute's 67th Foundation Day, IIT Kharagpur is gearing up to open a Centre of Excellence for research on Artificial Intelligence.

"Two Centres are being planned. One on AI research and one for extension of science and heritage part (the Sandhi science-culture initiative). Alumni is organising support for developing these two areas," IIT Kharagpur Director P.P. Chakrabarti said here during the institute's 67th Foundation Day.

"It will also get linked with the supercomputing facility, cloud computing etc. Additionally we want to do some really good projects in climate change and AI, big projects on healthcare and AI so that will require augmented funds," he said.

As conveyed by Professor P.P. Chakrabarti, on the ocassion of the institute's 67th Foundation Day, IIT Kharagpur is gearing up to open a Centre of Excellence for research on Artificial Intelligence.

"Two Centres are being planned. One on AI research and one for extension of science and heritage part (the Sandhi science-culture initiative). Alumni is organising support for developing these two areas," IIT Kharagpur Director P.P. Chakrabarti said here during the institute's 67th Foundation Day.

"It will also get linked with the supercomputing facility, cloud computing etc. Additionally we want to do some really good projects in climate change and AI, big projects on healthcare and AI so that will require augmented funds," he said.

Hola Freshers!

We hope you have started to settle into the daily bustle of the campus. In the past week you might have been glued to the notice boards of your halls, or rather they would have been glued with posters introducing a multitude of different societies and groups. Every society puts up a great effort just to capture a part of that board space, to ultimately capture your eye and even more to sell themselves to you later on. Before any narcissism creeps in, we would like to point out the importance of the existence of this plethora of opportunities out there. For starters, the sheer number of these societies is what differentiates KGP from the rest of the IITs. Topping that, over time, each of these societies have turned into hubs of creativity, intellectual might, cutting-edge research, sources of valuable insights and more than anything else, a great place to make friends and forge bonds that last forever.  

Hence we would like to bring to your notice a little project we did. Presenting the Periodic Table of KGPian Societies, an interactive compilation of all known societies in our campus so that you at least have a brief idea of what to expect in the coming days, make your choices wisely and play your cards right, both intellectually and socially.

https://thescholarsavenue.github.io/societytable/

P.S: Any societies that need any edits in their respective sections can ping us, or mail us (thescholarsavenue@gmail.com) with the edits.
We have only accounted groups that are open to all and are not limited by the Departments and we agree that we might have missed a few nevertheless.

Students of IIT Kharagpur have come up with innovative ideas in the past and present which have been able to make a positive impact in the society. The Entrepreneurial ventures of students  have a diversified range which generally come with an efficacious way to help out people and foster the culture of innovation. 

Prazium, by Enactus, IIT Kharagpur is one such Entrepreneurial action, which has won the 6th edition of the Saint Gobain Scholarship of Rs.1,00,000 for it's initial development, which was supported by Ethos so as to find a solution to the structural design problems faced today, using sustainable and eco-friendly methods. Hitesh Vyas, a 4th year architecture student, as one of the members of Enactus, presented the project in the National level competition held in May 2017 which was declared the winner of the scholarship. It tends to reduce the cost of construction and develop houses by using processed Bamboo as a replacement for steel reinforcements. 
Professor Damodar Maity of the Civil Engineering Department of IIT Kharagpur helped with the background research for this development. 

Prazium is an indigenous project in collaboration with the concrete laboratories at IIT Kharagpur and some of the prototypes have been practiced in the IIT Kharagpur’s campus itself. It now aims to provide the new development to the nearby rural areas to the campus and eventually expand throughout the country. 

The Scholars’ Avenue congratulates the Prazium team for their achievement and wishes them the best of luck for their future endeavors.

The proxy address for internet access is being changed to "172.16.2.30" by CIC for technical reasons related to upgradation of backend proxy servers. Users are requested to start using this new proxy address for internet access immediately instead of the existing address (10.3.100.207). For any problem with accessing the internet with the new proxy address, users are requested to report the problem to helpdesk@cc.iitkgp.ernet.in. 

The old proxy address (10.3.100.207) will also continue to be operational for some more time until further notice and will be taken off (with due notice beforehand) sometimes in end-July/early-August after the new proxy is stabilized. However, users are strongly recommended to start using the new proxy address immediately and report any problems to CIC helpdesk as the proxy address will change to this new one by end-July/early-August anyway. 

All other settings such as the existing proxy bypass i.e. "No Proxy for 10.0.0.0/8, .iitkgp.ernet.in and .iitkgp.ac.in" for internal servers will remain same for now. We request all to shift to the new address asap to help CIC root out any teething problems that may occur. Your cooperation is deeply appreciated. 

regards 
---------
CIC Support

We can be prepared for a more detailed induction programme from this semester onwards, it seems. This should go a long way in helping out students if implemented properly.

"Instead of one-time induction, refurbishing programmes have been planned round the year. For students of second year, an assimilation programme to departments and academics would be introduced. For third year students, a reorientation programme for pathway choices have been developed. In fourth year, the students would undergo a de-induction programme which would make them ready to face the world beyond the realms of family and educational institutions."

The Scholars' Avenue would like to bring notice to its readers about a Quantitative Research Summer Training Program that is being offered by WorldQuant from 1st June to 31st July, 2017. You can take a look at the details of the training below:

WorldQuant Summer Training Program
 
Based on the success of last year’s Quantitative Research Summer Training Program, we would like to invite applicants for the 2017 program.
 Our program offers distinctive hands-on experience in developing mathematical or quantitative models using our web-based stock simulation platform (Websim). With over 1300 registrations, 62 students across various schools in India qualified for the 2016 Summer Training Program to become Research Consultants with WorldQuant.

Our Summer Training Program is designed to offer insight into the quantitative model building space. The virtual training program is a unique learning opportunity within the investment management industry. It is a tailored program that combines virtual training and workshop sessions in developing alphas/trading models.
If you show potential and demonstrate exceptional performance during your time with us, you may be offered a part-time Research Consultant position with us. 

Below are a few key highlights of the Summer Training Program:
Ø  Regular online training sessions;

Ø  Mentoring and guidance from experienced quantitative researchers;

Ø  Eligible participants have the potential of being considered for a Research Consultant opportunity at the end of program, which may include aone-time special stipend of up to 1,00,000 INR;

Ø  Certificate from WorldQuant.

Participation Requirements:

Hold or working towards Bachelor’s degree or Master’s degree in Engineering, Science, Mathematics, Finance or any other related field that ishighly analytical and quantitative
1st and 2nd year students will be given preference
Have a strong interest in learning about worldwide financial markets
Submit applications to your placement team
Register for a Websim account [https://websim.worldquantchallenge.com/en/cms/wqc/summerprograms/indiatraining] If you have already expressed interest through your institution’s placement office, please make sure you sign up for an account using the same email address. Please fill out your academic profile when applying for a new account.
On Websim, when prompted, please confirm your interest in being considered for the Summer Training Program.
Space in the program is limited, so selection of candidates for the program will be based on the applicant’s activity in Websim and academic achievement among other factors.
 
Training Program Completion:
Trainees who attend all scheduled training sessions, complete assignments and build a score on Websim based on the alphas they submit will receive a completion certificate at the end of the training program.
In addition, we may offer Research Consultant positions to candidates who complete the training successfully, and a one-time special stipend maybe awarded to outstanding performers upon becoming a Research Consultant.
Research Consultant offers are at our sole discretion and are subject to a background check and other applicable eligibility requirements.

Two of our students Sahashranshu Maurya and Somrup Chakraborty have been selected to represent our institute on the international stage this year, through their team TAKNIQUEE, which has been shortlisted for the finals of the Shell Ideas 360 2016/2017, a student collaborative programme which features in the list of top ten student competitions in the world.  The winner would be chosen through a voting platform, called the Audience Choice Awards. 
TAKNIQUEE from IIT KGP has come up with an innovative approach to tackle the energy problem and achieve cooling in the midst of summers using an energy-friendly approach. The name of their idea is "Passive Solar Water Wall". 
They will be fighting it out for the maximum number of votes with 4 other universities, namely, Nanyang Technological University (Singapore), Delft University of Technology (Netherlands), University of Texas at Austin (USA) and University of Cambridge (UK), who themselves have put forth new ways to tip the energy scale.

You can showcase your support to the team by voting for the team at the link provided below. The voting will close on the 23rd of May and the results will be announced on the 25th of May. The team will be on it's way to London on the 24th of May to give a final presentation.

For more details about the teams and their ideas, as well as for voting for our team, please visit 

http://www.shellideas360.com/audience-choice-awards/

The Scholars' Avenue congratulates the team and wishes it all the best for the finals.

We are very sorry to inform you that 4 Alumni of IIT KGP met with an accident in Hyderabad today morning at 7:40, out of which 3 succumbed to death. All of them were graduates working in different IT firms. They were to attend a marriage when they met with this fatal mishap after being grazed by a truck. Ravi Teja and Surya Teja died on the spot, while Rohit breathed his last during the treatment.

We offer condolences to their families, and pray with all our hearts that this unfortunate trend of deaths in/related to our institute does not continue any further. 

http://www.newindianexpress.com/cities/hyderabad/2017/may/13/three-techies-die-as-car-rams-railing-on-outer-ring-road-in-hyderabad-1604275.html

story: The Scholars' Avenue shared Kharagpur Open Source Society - KOSS's post.
message: The Scholars' Avenue shared Kharagpur Open Source Society - KOSS's post. Finally, GSoC 2017 results are out ! Congratulations to all the selected KGPians. The count from IIT Kharagpur is whopping 30 so far! The number of selections from KGP has almost been doubling up since the past three years consecutively. On a lighter note, KOSS congratulates 6 of its members (Mayank Jindal, Ayush Goyal, Parth Verma, Nitin Choudhary, Prathamesh Chavan, Rishabh Madan) for making it through. We also have Avijit, Kshitij, Nishant and Himanshu as GSoC mentors this year! Here is the complete list : https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/10RlfMlhBwQZGxEoo9AvQ5YPYWadf0mXAAasnKiUR_rY

As part of our series on overcoming depression, here's sharing Debanjana's story. She's successfully overcome her depression and in line with her childhood dream is going to the US for PhD. Cheers to life, indeed! :)

As part of our series on overcoming depression, here's sharing Debanjana's story. She's successfully overcome her depression and in line with her childhood dream is going to the US for PhD. Cheers to life, indeed! :)

In the light of recent events, The Scholars' Avenue is sharing stories from people on campus who've successfully dealt with depression. 

Here's the story of Charan Raj, a student of IIT Kharagpur and his astounding account of fighting VITILIGO and depression. If you too are battling with depression or suicidal thoughts or have successfully overcome them, you are welcome to share your story via TSA open blog(https://tsablog.quora.com/)

For those suffering out there, you are not alone. Your difficulties are not unsurmountable as attested to, by brave people like Charan. Please don't give up, please reach out, we are here to help you. :)

If you too are battling with depression or suicidal thoughts or have successfully overcome them, you are welcome to share your story via TSA open blog(https://tsablog.quora.com/)

For those suffering out there, you are not alone. Your difficulties are not unsurmountable as attested to, by brave people like Charan. Please don't give up, please reach out, we are here to help you. :)
